1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Gill's Onions has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. Nevertheless, Gill's Onions continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM Program. This has improved Gill's Onions ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Gill's Onions management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM Program is being implemented.

Gill's Onions has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM Program. When a RMP-PSM Program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Gill's Onions has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM Program implementation.

Gill's Onions considers the RMP-PSM Program a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Gill's Onions employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM Program Gill's Onions will continue to maintain overall plant worker, public, and environmental safety.

1.5.1 Emergency Response Coordination Activities

The purpose of emergency response coordination activities is to coordinate response needs with local emergency planning and response organizations. The intent is for local response organizations to be made aware of the regulated substances at Gill's Onions, their quantities, the risks presented by the covered processes, and the resources and capabilities at our facility to respond to an accidental release of a regulated substance. The emergency response coordination activities will consist of the following:

Coordinations will be completed at least annually. Additional coordinations will be made to account for changes at our facility that may affect the community emergency response plan.
Coordinations will include Gill's Onionss emergency response plan, updated emergency contact information, and any other information necessary for developing and implementing the local emergency response plan.

Coordination activities will be appropriately documented. The coordination records will include the names of individuals involved and their contact information (phone number, email address, and organizational affiliations), dates of coordination activities, and nature of coordination activities.

The disclosure of information classified or restricted by the Department of Defense or other Federal agencies or contractors of such agencies is controlled by applicable laws, regulations, or executive orders concerning the release of that classified or restricted information.

1.5.2 Emergency Response Notification Exercises

At least once per calendar year, Gill's Onions will conduct an exercise of the facilitys emergency response notifications mechanism. The facility will record each notification exercise utilizing PSMWriter.

1.4 Five Year Accident History

On 9/16/2022 Gill's Onions had an accidental release of ammonia. The accident occurred at approximately 9pm. The accident occurred when a solenoid coil had grounded to plunger tube and burned hole on post causing liquid ammonia to leak. The release was determined to be caused by the malfunctioning solenoid valve. The duration of the release was estimated to be 6 hours 18 minutes. The amount of ammonia released was estimated to be approximately 1,095.2 lb. The local CUPA, 911, CalOES, and the National Response Center were notified.
An investigation was performed and the following recommendations were made and are being resolved:

Recommendation 1: During the emergency response, there was confusion as to which agencies were required to be notified and what order the notifications should be made. Train appropriate personnel responsible for making the release notifications on the appropriate agencies to be notified in the event of an ammonia release, order of notifications, and timeline to make such notifications.

Recommendation 2: Due to the failure of a solenoid valve, a hole developed in the plunger for Coil 3 on the hot gas defrost line which led to an accidental release of ammonia. Ensure that the solenoid valve is replaced and that the system is safe prior to start-up.

Facility Overview

Gill's Onions operates a commercial cold storage for onions in Oxnard, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(1) Cold Storage Room
(1) Shipping Vestibule

(2) Processing Areas
(2) Packaging Areas
(6) Plate Water Chillers

Facility Location

Gill's Onions is located at 1051 Pacific Ave. Oxnard, CA 93030. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 34.191478, -119.165720. The facility is located approximately 1.5 miles west of state highway 1 in an industrial area surrounded primarily by businesses.
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.

Gill's Onions is located within the Oxnard Alquist-Priolo Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation which is classified as a landslide and liquefaction zone. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed the following faults within close proximity:

California Offshore: unspecified - <1,600,000 Years
McGrath Fault - <1,600,000 Years
Montalvo Fault - <15,000 Years
Oak Ridge Fault - <15,000 Years

The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Gill's Onions has a 2-5% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program  Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program  Title 8 CCR §5189

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM Program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Gill's Onions has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities.
